result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin A Bey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Kidnapping/Seize or Confine w/o Consent [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.31(1)(b).
  • 2nd-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.05(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: #1 - picture of injured left foot; #2 - picture of injured left foot (different angel); #3 - picture of skin graph; #4 - picture of left toe; #5 - picture of left foot without toes; #6 - picture of left foot without toes (different angel); #7 - picture of both feet; #8 - CPD Inciden report #15-0662; #9 - VIS

Defendant Justin A Bey in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Defendant Justin A Bey in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:30 PM. Court has PSI and also received a one page correction document to add to the PSI. All parties have the PSI and the corrections. All parties want to proceed to PSI. State - states plea agreement - remain bound to one of two options, 30 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 20  years of initial confinement followed by 10 years of ES or bound (free) to argue within range of PSI if it came under 30 years total, defense is free to argue. Court asks for clarification. State responds. Hughes agrees. State - administrative matters - all parties received a correction to PSI today (clerical matter on page 29). Hughes still willing to proceed to sentencing even after receiving correction to PSI today. Hughes - will make any corrections needed to PSI in sentencing argument. Hughes agrees. State - has distributed to both defense and Court 8 pre-marked exhibits (most submitted during co-defendant's trial) and will be referring to the exhibits during his sentencing argument. Hughes has received all the exhibits. Hughes has no objections to the exhibits. Court has also received a victim impact statement today and will mark it as exhibit #9. Court receives all 9 exhibits after no objections (1:36 PM). State makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends on count #6 - 26 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 16 years of initial confinement followed by 10 years of ES; count #5 - 24 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 16 years of initial confinment followed by 8 years of ES - concurrent to count #6; count #2 - 5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES - concurrent to other counts; #8 - 9 months in jail - concurrent to other counts; restitution of $44,000.00 including VW surcharge for crime victim compensation and joint and several, stipulate to 517 days credit. Court has read the VIS (exhibit #9). Victim does not want to address the court other than the submission of his VIS. Hughes makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends on counts #5 and #6 - 15 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 5 years of initial confinement followed by 10 years of ES - concurrent to each other; count #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 6 years, #8 - 9 months - all to run concurrent to each other. Bey makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #6 - 25 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 15  years of initial confinement followed by 10 years of ES; count #5 - 18 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 12 years of initial confinement followed by 6 years of ES - concurrent to count #6; #2 - 5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES - consecutive to count #6; #8 - 9 months in jail - concurrent to count #6, ES conditions include: finds restitution is appropriate and will order it of $44,000.00 inlcuding $4000.00 VW surcharge - paid thru ES and to be paid with 25% of any prison wages or monies he is entitled to - joint and several with co-defendant, court costs on each count - paid thru ES, credit for 517 days, no voting rights, no possession of firearms, right to appeal.
DVD of March 13, 2014 Interview with Justin Bey - 201400003422

Defendant Justin A Bey, in custody, in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Special prosecutor, Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. District Attorney, Charles J. Simono appears via phone, also for the State of Wisconsin.  Called 11:09 am.  Bednar recites terms of plea agreement; Ct 1 DRI; Ct 2 defendant will enter a guilty plea as alleged, Cts 3 & 4 DRI; Ct 5 defendant will enter guilty plea as alleged; Ct 6 moves to amend to 2nd degree attempted homicide as PTAC contrary to 940.05(1)(a), 939.32 & 939.05; Ct 7 DRI; Ct 8 defendant will enter guilty plea as alleged; Ct 9 DRI.  Parties will jointly request PSI; State will request 30 year prison term consisting of 20 yrs IC & 10 yrs ES; will agree to be bound by lessor of stated or recommendation of PSI; if PSI recomendation is lower; State will be free to argue; victim notification has been complied with.  Hughes agrees with terms; submits signed plea questionnaire to Court;  Court grants State's motion; Cts 1, 3, 4, 7 & 9 DRI; reads counts 2, 5 & 8 as alleged and Ct 6 as amended; should be 940.05 (1)(b); Hughes enters guilty pleas; Bey agrees to entry of guilty pleas. Court advises of rights; waived; finds lawful, accepts plea and adjudges guilty. Will schedule sentencing after Jones trial in May.  11:23 off record for purposes of scheduling.  State will ask for remand Tuesday, August 11th at 1:30 pm sentencing.  11:29 am back on record.  Will sign order for PSI; Simono requesting quashing of bond and remand to Forest County Jail; Bednar adds that he needs to be available for PSI; Hughes objects to remand; State's motion granted.  11:32 am adjourned.

Defendant Justin A Bey in court/custody with attorney Michael D. Hughes.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge Bloom appears telephonically via phone from Oneida Co. Called 2:35 pm. State indicates have return on NGI result and Hughes will ask for status and state wants to get in on the calendar. Court has the NGI evaluation and has reviewed. Hughes recently received and asks for another status to meet with his client and make some decisions. Court will set both status and JT date. Back on record 2:48 pm. Status scheduled - Judge Bloom's JA will contact counsel and JA in Forest to get JT date. Formal trial date will be set at status. Simono will be filing joint actions. Adj.  Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 16, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 3, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
for examination under 971.16 - faxed to BCI

Called at 1:46 PM. Justin Bey appears in person and in custody with counsel Michael Hughes. State appears by Charles Simono. Court- Hughes has filed two motions (motion to enlarge time limits and motion to withdraw plea and enter NGI plea) - court has reviewed the motion to enlarge time limits. State has no objections to the motion to enlarge time limts at this point regarding discovery. Court will grant motion to enlarge time limits - proceed to second motion. State objects to motion for change of plea and entry of NGI plea due to mental disease/defect for stated reasons. Hughes makes argument for his motion - asks Court to grant motion. Court will grant the motion for change of plea due and will allow the change of plea accordingly - signs Order for Examination in court. Future scheduling on this matter will be done with both JA's and/or COC in Forest County in near future. Court continues bond at this point.

Called at 1:35 PM. Also called 14CF32, 14CF33, 14CF35 and 14CM81. April Jones appears in person and in custody with counsel Sheila Kessler. Raymond Jones appears in person and in custody with her counsel Brian Bennett. Justin Bey appears in person and in custody with counsel Michael Hughes. Samantha McClellan appears in person and with counsel Thomas McClure. Court has reviewed the motion that was filed by Attorney McClure for his client. All counsel ready to proceed to ARGN today, all counsel willing to waive reading of Information, all counsel pleads NG to all counts on all complaints. Kessler stands mute and asks court to enter NG plea on her behalf. Court does. State and counsel wish to schedule all matters for PTC, Bennett will be filing at least one motion prior to PTC and wishes to extend 10 day time limit for that, Kessler joins in on that statement as well. McClure wants his motion heard ASAP, other counsel OK with getting motion hearing date after PTC. Court sets 13CF35 for motion hearing on 6/3/14 at 3:00 PM and PTC on 7/28/14 at 3:00 PM, state to submit any responses 7 calendar days prior to 6/3/14, all other cases will be set for PTC on 7/28/14 at 1:30 PM, counsel to work with JA Shawl for motion hearing dates, court continues bond on all cases, grants extension of 10 day period time for filing motions, adjourned.
Pre-trial conference on July 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: #1 - Sgt. Ashbeck's report; #2  Dr. Maldonado's report; #3 - Tonya Malone's statement

Called at 3:46 PM. Also called other co-defendants cases of 14CF32, 14CF33 and 14CF35. Raymond Jones appears in person and in custody with attorney Galen Bayne-Allison appearing specially for Brian Bennett; April Jones appears in person and in custody with attorney Sheila Kessler; Justin Bey appears in person and in custody with attorney Michael Hughes and Samantha McClellan appears in person and with counsel Thomas McClure. State calling one witness out of order for stated reasons. State calls Dr. Ivan Maldonado. State will have to recall him later as he is not available. State now calls Deputy Steve Ashbeck. Ashbeck sworn in at 3:54 PM. Direct exam by State. State marks exhibit #1. Record reflects proper identification of defendant Justin Bey. State offers exhibit #1 (4:21 PM). Court receives exhibit #1 after no objections (4:23 PM). Court reflects proper identification of defendant Raymond Jones. Court reflects proper identification of defendant April Jones. Record reflects proper identification of Samantha McClellan. Cross exam by Michael Hughes at 4:27 PM. State objects - relevance. Galen-Bayne Allison objects - relevance. Court sustains objections. Statre objects - relevance. Bayne-Allison - no foundation. Court sustains both objections. State objects - no reason. Court overrules. State objects - relevance - overruled. Cross exam by Sheila Kessler at 4:34 PM. Cross exam by Bayne-Allison at 4:37 PM. Ashbeck steps down momentarily to contact another witness - Dr. Ivan Maldonado. State calls Dr. Maldonado sworn in at 4:40 PM. Direct exam by State. All counsel stipulates to Dr. Maldonado's qualifications. Kessler objects to the fact that the doctor may be testifying from medical records and they do not have copies of them for today's proceedings. Court instructs. Witness verifies. State asks the witness to only testify off the medical records from his facility and no other facilities. Court makes copies of these records for all counsel. Cross exam by Michael Hughes at 4:59 PM. The report that the doctor was referring to is marked as exhibit #2, received after no objectons (5:00 PM). State objects - relevance - sustained. No questions from Kessler or Bayne-Allison. Cross exam by McClure at 5:07 PM. Dr. Maldonado excused at 5:09 PM. Ashbeck retakes the stand at 5:09 PM, still under oath. No more questions by counsel. Ashbeck excused at 5:09 PM. State calls Lieutenant Karcz. Karcz sworn in at 5:10 PM. Direct exam by State. Court instructs all witness to not use childrens names during testimony (5:14 PM). Cross exam by Hughes at 5:29 PM. Cross exam by Bayne-Allison at 5:31 PM. State objects - relevance - sustained (5:32 PM). Karcz excused at 5:32 PM. State calls Captain Marvin. Marvin sworn in at 5:32 PM. Direct exam by State. McClure objects - sustained (5:43 PM). State marks exhibit #3 and offers exhibit #3 (5:46 PM). Court receives exhibit #3 after no objections (5:47 PM). Recess at 5:48 PM. Recalled at 5:59 PM. Direct exam continues. Cross exam by Hughes at 6:01 PM. State objects - relevance - overruled (6:02 PM). Cross exam by Kessler at 6:02 PM. Cross exam by Bayne-Allison at 6:03 PM. Cross exam by McClure at 6:04 PM. State objects - relevance - sustained (6:05 PM). Re-direct by State at 6:06 PM. Re-cross by McClure at 6:08 PM. Court has questions of witness. Re-direct by State at 6:10 PM. Marvin excused at 6:11 PM. State relies on testimony rather than further argument. Court finds probable cause that a felony was commited by Justin Bey and Raymond Jones. State makes argument for Court to find probable cause on Samantha McClellan but willing to concede on April Jones for stated reasons. Kessler makes argument - does not believe State has met its burden at this point - asks for dismissal of felony counts. McClure makes argument - does not believe State has met its burden at this point - asks for dismissal of felony counts. State responds. McClure makes final rejoinder. State responds. Court makes ruling on McClellan and April Jones - finds probable cause that both these individiuals committed a felony - binds both over trial. Court continues bond on all defendants, set all matters for ARGN. Hughes files a joined defendants request for substitition of Judge on all cases. Court accepts request for substitution.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign denied

No consumption of alcohol. No contact with the victims. - REFUSED TO SIGN
Adjourned initial appearance on March 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Called at 1:09 PM. Justin Bey appears via video from FOSO and Attorney John Rhode appears specially today by SPD appointment and may be limited to today's proceedings only. State appears by  Charles Simono. Rhode has complaint but has not had a chance to go over it with the defendant. Bey does have complaint also. Rhode would like charges and penalties read. Court reads charges and penalties. Rhode makes statement regarding his special appearance today and is not comfortable making the decision of waiving time limits for stated reasons - believe he will be found eligible for SPD. Court sets for AIA on 3/24/14 at 1:00 PM. State - bond - asks for an increase in cash bond to $100,000.00. Rhode - bond - objects to higher cash bond and asks for signature bond or $1,000.00 cash. Bey makes statement regarding bond - willing to do ankle bracelet. State - bond - makes additional comments. Bey responds. Court - bond - increases bond to $100,000.00 with same conditions for stated reasons.
No consumption of alcohol and no contact with the victim. (Refused)
